questions.question: Which of the following correctly summarizes Newton's 1st Law of Motion?

choices.answer: objects tend to randomly stop what they are doing
objects tend to keep on doing what they are doing
all objects tend to have equal & opposite reaction
an object's weight & mass will determine the amount of force

questions.question: Newton's 1st Law states objects stay in a state of inertia unless ________.

choices.answer: their mass exceeds 1,000 kg
they are already accelerating
a balanced force acts upon them
an unbalanced force acts upon them

questions.question: Without an unbalanced force, a car traveling 50m/s, east will be doing what in 5 minutes?

choices.answer: traveling 50 m/s east
traveling 50 m/s west
gaining speed to 65 m/s east
slowing down to 25 m/s east

questions.question: In 10 years, a desk sitting in the NW corner of a room with no unbalanced forces on it will be:

choices.answer: in the NE corner of that room
in the SW corner of that room
in the NW corner of that room
in the SE corner of that room

questions.question: Why would water filled to the rim of a resting glass spill over the sides when moved?

choices.answer: the water stayed at rest while glass was put in motion
the water was put in motion while the glass stayed at rest
the force applied by a person's hand created the movement
the mass of the water is lighter than the glass

questions.question: If a football is resting on a tee, what type of force creates motion when it is kicked?

choices.answer: gravity
tension
friction
air resistance

questions.question: What term is used to describe the resistance to a change in motion?

choices.answer: velocity
acceleration
friction
inertia

questions.question: T/F: Objects at rest want to have an unbalanced force applied to them.

choices.answer: TRUE
FALSE

questions.question: An object at rest has a velocity that measures:

choices.answer: zero
10 m/s<sup>2</sup>
a velocity equal to the force of gravity
a velocity equal to its mass

questions.question: When a car applies the brakes why do you feel yourself slide forward in the seat?

choices.answer: you have stopped, but inertia keeps the car moving forward
inertia keeps you moving forward though the car has stopped

questions.question: A bike is traveling 15 mph and suddenly stops after hitting a curb.  What happens to the rider?

choices.answer: the rider stops with the bike
the rider moves backwards at 15 mph
the rider continues to go forward 15 mph
the rider will fall sideways off of the bike

questions.question: When descending on an elevator that stops, why do some people experience dizziness?

choices.answer: blood continues moving downward away from the brain
blood rushes upwards towards the brain
the velocity of the movement creates weightlessness
the sudden stop creates the feeling of dizziness

questions.question: T/F: Without any unbalanced forces, the ISS will continue to move at a velocity of 28,000 kph.

choices.answer: TRUE
FALSE

questions.question: A car traveling 50 kph is hit from behind and goes 53 kph.  Why can this cause whiplash?

choices.answer: It won't.  The body will also speed up to 53 kph.
The body will be moving faster than the car.
The sudden impact stops the body's movement immediately.
The body stays at 50 kph while the car increases to 53 kph.

questions.question: You're holding a soda in a stopped car. When the car moves forward, what happens to the soda?

choices.answer: it accelerates forward with the car
it remains at rest and spills backward onto your lap
it remains at rest and spills forward onto the floor
the soda has no reaction and remains in the cup
